data.name: Short Quotes
data.description:
In this kata, your challenge is to take a quote in the form of a string ```(quote)``` and shorten it to a given maximum length ```(max)```. 

The shortened quote should end with an ellipsis (...). The ellipsis should be taken into account in the overall length.

If the quote is empty or shorter than ```max```, return the quote.

If the quote is cut off mid-word, the incomplete word should be removed from the string and replaced by an ellipsis. In addition, if the string ends with another punctuation mark or a space before the ellipsis, that punctuation mark or space should be removed. In both cases the resulting string may be shorter than the maximum length. 

For example:

'This is a quot...' should be 'This is a...'

'This is a quote!...' should be 'This is a quote...'

'This is a quote ...' should be 'This is a quote...'

For the purposes of this kata, all punctuation marks will be followed by a space. The only punctuation marks that might appear in the quote will be: ! ? . , ; : -
